plugins.name: Adee Comprehensive Accessibility Tool
plugins.description:
Adee is a comprehensive and powerful accessibility testing tool. You can test color contrast and apply changes, simulate 8 color blind simulations and generate them, test touch target sized to make sure they meet the various device standards and share test results with your team! ... and more!


‚òÖ Features:

  • Alt Text Generator

‚úì Generate Alt Text for Svg, Png, Jpg images

‚úì Automatic image format detection.

‚úì Add the following information to generate Alt Text:

‚ó¶ Whether the image is Informative / Decorative

‚ó¶ Image Title

‚ó¶ Image Description

‚ó¶ Code/Tag recommendations

‚úì Bulk adds, remove, reorder and update

‚úì generate and share with the team


  • Touch Target Size Standard checker

‚úì Check your touch targets have correct size based on the following criteria:

‚úì Apple touch devices

‚úì Android touch devices

‚úì Nielsen

‚úì WCAG

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ And smart suggestion to meet the standards and requirements! to make sure your design is accessible on touch devices.


How it works:

-       Select touch target size tab (hand icon)

-       From the first dropdown menu > Select the device you want to test your touch target size in

-       From the second drop down menu > Select your touch target (such as a button, link, or any other type of hyperlinks)

-       Then a table shows the test results and recommended standard sizes for your design to make sure it's accessible on touch devices


Check Adee touch target detailed instructions!


  • Colorblind Simulator

‚úì Simulate 8 different forms of

    color-blindness

‚úì Modes and views comparison

‚úì Colorblind Generator

‚úì Black and White simulation

‚úì Share the test results with your team


Check Adee Colorblind simulator detailed instructions!


  • Comprehensive Contrast Checker

‚úì Based on WCAG guideline.

You can:

‚úì Easily Adjust Your Color Contrast

‚úì Swipe Layers and Colors

‚úì Live preview

‚úì Easily Undo to Original Color

‚úì Apply changes to your design

‚úì Access to your saved/global colors

‚úì Share the test results with your team


Check Adee contrast checker detailed instructions!


  • Share!

‚úì Generate report and share them with your team!


Check Adee's terms and condition

plugins.name: Icons ‚Üí Code
plugins.description:
The Design System Middleware that allows you to manage, import, convert and sync graphical assets or icons directly from Figma into your application code.


Direct export options

(Export 50 icons for free - no subscription required)

----------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ React (.js)

‚Ä¢ Vue (.js)

‚Ä¢ Angular (.js)

‚Ä¢ Meteor (.html)

‚Ä¢ ReactNative (.js)

‚Ä¢ Android (.xml)

‚Ä¢ iOS (.pdf)

‚Ä¢ Icon Font (.ttf)

‚Ä¢ Vector Graphic (.svg) (minified)

‚Ä¢ CSS Sprite (.svg)

‚Ä¢ ICO (.ico)

‚Ä¢ EPS (.eps)

‚Ä¢ Portable Document (.pdf)


Build a custom component (with subscription)

----------------------------------------

Upload custom code and set a file type of choice to then be able to export icons based on your template.


Updating boards (with subscription)

----------------------------------------

Push updates or changes to an existing or new icanicon.io board to enable team-wide access, the API, and the sync command.


How to use the plugin

----------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ Select all icons you would like to export, choose an export option and click the export button.


Good to know

----------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ You can download a template in case you are uncertain about the structure: https://icanicon.io/syncing-figma-files

‚Ä¢ Avoid including mockups, more complex components, or other elements that are not meant to be icons in your export file.

‚Ä¢ Choose your file naming-convention wisely as these names might carry over to your codebase.


Other features (with subscription)

----------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ NPM Command: In your icon directory execute our ii-client command to sync your assets locally

‚Ä¢ API Access: Use your token to fetch any icon, segment, or board

‚Ä¢ File-less Rendering: This opens up the possibility of integrating your icons without the need for handling files at all.


Thanks, and enjoy it!

Your Sugarcode Team

accepted.description: We are a conglomerate of industry professionals - Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - tackling challenging creative and technical concepts.

plugins.name: Fill Rule Editor
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you edit the fill rules of a vector object. Fill rules determine which parts of a vector outline are filled. The fill rules have different behavior when a vector outline overlaps.

Why is this useful? Certain export formats (e.g. TrueType fonts, Android VectorDrawable) only support the non-zero fill rule. You can use this plugin to manually convert even-odd to non-zero to make the exporters for these formats work.

1618.name: Fill Rule Editor
1618.description:
This plugin lets you edit the fill rules of a vector object. Fill rules determine which parts of a vector outline are filled. The fill rules have different behavior when a vector outline overlaps.

Why is this useful? Certain export formats (e.g. TrueType fonts, Android VectorDrawable) only support the non-zero fill rule. You can use this plugin to manually convert even-odd to non-zero to make the exporters for these formats work.

plugins.name: Color Palettes
plugins.description:
Unlock a universe of vibrant possibilities with this expansive collection of 1,00,000+ expertly curated color palettes, seamlessly integrated within Figma for effortless design exploration.


Figma, a popular design tool, offers a variety of plugins to enhance workflows. Color palette plugins are some of the most useful, helping designers create and manage color schemes efficiently. Here's a breakdown of their functionality and how different design professionals can benefit:


What they do:


Generate palettes: These plugins can create color schemes based on a starting color, using design principles like complementary or analogous colors. This is helpful for getting inspiration and exploring different options.

Extract palettes: Some plugins can pull color palettes directly from uploaded images. This is great for designers working with existing brand materials or drawing inspiration from photographs.

Manage palettes: These plugins allow for easy organization and storage of color schemes. Designers can create libraries of their own palettes or access pre-built ones.

Benefits for various designers:


UI/UX Designers: These plugins streamline the process of creating consistent and visually appealing color schemes for interfaces and user experiences. Easy access to pre-built palettes ensures adherence to brand guidelines while also offering options for exploration.

Graphic Designers: Generate color harmonies that complement each other perfectly for layouts, posters, and other graphic design projects. Extracting palettes from images allows for cohesive design elements that match existing visual content.

Web Designers: Ensure color accessibility with built-in contrast checkers in some plugins. This is crucial for creating inclusive designs that cater to users with visual impairments.

Product Designers: Maintain color consistency across all aspects of a product, from physical mockups to digital interfaces. Plugins with palette management features help keep track of color schemes used in various components.

Finding the right plugin:


With a variety of color palette plugins available in the Figma community, there's one for every need. Explore options based on features, user reviews, and popularity.


Beyond the plugins:


While plugins offer a great starting point, remember that design principles and a good eye for color are still essential. Don't be afraid to experiment and adjust palettes to achieve the perfect look and feel for your project.

plugins.name: BrandBird ‚Äì Turn frames into beautiful social media posts
plugins.description:
‚ú® The official Brandbird.app Figma plugin!

With BrandBird you can turn any image into a stunning social media post in seconds!


‚öôÔ∏è How it works

It's pretty simple to use it:

  1. Pick an image or a frame
  2. Run the "‚ú® Open BrandBird" command
  3. Add cool backgrounds, 3D effects, device mockups, annotate the image, and many more
  4. Once you're satisfied with the result, hit the "Export to Figma" button, and the image will be imported on your canvas as a separate layer


‚≠ê BrandBird PRO

You don't need a BrandBird account to use the app. All our features are available for you and you can use them for free.


The only limitation for the free tier is the BrandBird watermark on the bottom right corner of the exported image.


To remove the watermark, and access all our advance features (save templates, custom watermark etc), you need a BrandBird PRO account.


Visit this link to learn more


üîó How to connect your PRO BrandBird account

  1. Visit your BrandBird account page on the web
  2. Find and copy your unique personal API key
  3. Run the Figma plugin command "üîë Set my API key" , paste your API key and hit save


‚ò†Ô∏è Keep your API key safe and don't share it with anyone. If you believe that your API key is exposed in the public, please re-generate a new one.

accepted.name: Jim Raptis
accepted.description: Crafting handy tools to modernize design process

plugins.tagline: Turn your Figma frames into beautiful mockups with device mockups, 3D effects, and more.

plugins.name: Content Buddy
plugins.description:
Edit the text content in multiple layers, instances and components in Figma and FigJam files.


Content Buddy searches for text layers in your selection and displays a list with each text so you can select any text individually or using multiple selections to set a replacement for all the layers where the original text appears.


Replacement can be done as simple text replacement or using *AI prompts to translate, iterate or make text shorter/longer.


Content Buddy works in instances, components, frames , groups and text shapes both for Figma and FigJam files.


* AI replacements requires an OpenAI API token to work.

Material Design Icons is the oldest and largest community-driven icon library following Google's Material Design guidelines. Since its inception in 2017, the library has grown exponentially from over 150 unique contributors from all around the world!


Using our official Material Design Icons Figma plugin, you can easily search the MDI library and drop our icons directly into your designs without having to leave Figma!
54009.release_notes: - All icons will now be added in a standard 24x24dp container, as per Material guidelines.
54009.tagline: Following Google's Material Design guidelines for system icons, MDI touts over 7200 unique icons!

plugins.name: Material Symbols (Icons) Pro
plugins.description:
Material Symbols (Icons) Pro is a Figma plugin that allows you to search and add Material Design icons to your designs. It provides a variety of features, including:

  1. Search icons by category, type, and metadata
  2. Drag and drop icons into your Figma file
  3. Create component sets for each icon (coming soon)
  4. Update icons with new versions (coming soon)


Features:

  1. Search icons by category: Easily find the icons you need by browsing through the different categories, such as actions, devices, and more.
  2. Search icons by type: Choose from outline, rounded, or sharp icons to match your design style.
  3. Search icons by metadata: Find icons with relevant tags
  4. Drag and drop icons into your Figma file: Quickly add icons to your designs with a single drag and drop.
  5. Create component sets for each icon (coming soon) : Organize your icons into reusable component sets for easy access.
  6. Update icons with new versions (coming soon): Stay up-to-date with the latest versions of your favorite icons.

Benefits:

  1. Save time and effort by easily finding and adding icons to your designs.
  2. Create consistent and reusable icon sets for your projects.
  3. Stay up-to-date with the latest versions of your favorite icons.


How to use:

  1. Install the Material Symbols (Icons) Pro plugin from the Figma Community.
  2. Open the plugin panel by clicking on the plugin icon in the top right corner of the Figma window.
  3. Search for the icon you want to use.
  4. Drag and drop the icon into your Figma file.

accepted.name: Figterate
accepted.description: We build figma plugins to iterate faster.

plugins.name: Arc Reactor
plugins.description:
Arc Reactor is a basic utility for editing arc data in Figma. Instead of using percentages, you can select an ellipse to:


‚Ä¢ Set radius values in pixels

‚Ä¢ Set sweep start and end values in degrees

‚Ä¢ Set zero-degree origin at top, right, bottom or left


Arc Reactor gives you more precise control over arcs and converts these values automatically.


If you select an ellipse, your changes will apply to that selection. If no ellipse is selected, a new arc will be created for you.

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: SVG Converter
plugins.description:
Guide for using the plugin to generate SVG code from a selected frame or image

  1. Launch the plugin and authenticate.
  2. In the Figma layout, select the frame you need.
  • In the plugin, press the button that corresponds with the desired SVG code format: HTML, CSS, or IMG.The SVG in HTML format will look like this: <svg>...</svg>.
  • The SVG in CSS format will look like this: background: url(...).
  • The SVG in IMG format will look like this: <img src="...">.
  1. The selected frame will be converted into code and automatically copied to your clipboard.
  2. Paste the copied code into your code editor by pressing CTRL+V or by right-clicking in the code editor field.
plugins.tagline: Boosting your workflow efficiency: transforming your icons into code instantly!

plugins.name: Graphviz
plugins.description:
Generate and maintain complex information graphs in Figma using Graphviz. Graphs are defined using a simple text language (‚Äúdot‚Äù) and the source code for a graph is stored on the canvas graph object, making it really easy to share graphs that are editable as well as making changes.

Gallery and examples: https://www.figma.com/c/file/773333023004630195

This plugin uses a WebAssembly version of Graphviz (https://www.graphviz.org/) which is an open-source library for generating these graphs.

Documentation
-> Node shapes: https://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html
-> Attributes: https://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html

plugins.name: Text From Image
plugins.description:
Use OCR to copy text from an image fill.

Ever wish you could quickly grab some text from a static image? This plugin makes it easy with the magic of optical character recognition.

KNOWN PROBLEMS
* If you attempt to run the plugin on a static image larger than 1MB with a free API key, it will silently fail. Working on an error message right now.
* Current workaround: resize the image to a smaller size, copy as PNG, paste it back onto the cavnas, rerun the plugin on the new, smaller image.
* Alternatively, you can upgrade your API key to the paid tier at OCR.Space.

HOW IT WORKS
* This plugin takes advantage of the free API offered by OCR.Space (https://ocr.space). You'll need to acquire your own free API key here: https://ocr.space/OCRAPI#free
* Copy your API key and paste it into the plugin.
* Once your key is saved, select a layer with a static image as a fill, and run the plugin
* After a brief delay, the text will be copied to your clipboard, ready to be pasted.

LIMITATIONS
* You can only select one layer at a time currently
* If an image has more than one image fill, it will only work for the top one
* As a quirk of how the plugin was made, you will briefly see a non-interactive window pop up. This allows for content to be added to your clipboard.
* In addition, the same limitations that apply to OCR.Space's API free tier applies obviously to this plugin, such as file size limit, and rate limiting. See full info here: https://ocr.space/OCRAPI

This plugin is 100% open source. Feel free to open issues or pull requests at https://github.com/mkwng/Text-From-Image

plugins.name: Wave Generator
plugins.description:
Overview

Wave Generator is a Figma plugin designed to flexibly and efficiently create waveforms that are invaluable for various design productions. It was born to assist and enhance your designs.

It's sure to be a valuable asset in elevating your design work.


Features

RealTime Preview

Each time you adjust the settings within the plugin, you can see how the waveform transforms in real-time. Play around with various settings to create your ideal waveform.

Presets

I've prepared a variety of waveforms (presets) for you to choose from. Feel free to use any that you prefer. (If this plugin proves useful to many of you, I'm considering adding, saving, and sharing preset features in the future.)

Parameters

This plugin boasts a vast array of settings:

  1. Curve type
  2. Overall waveform type
  3. Number of waves
  4. Height difference between waves
  5. Wave intensity
  6. Number of wave reflections
  7. Presence and color of fill
  8. Presence, color, and width of the stroke

There probably isn't another waveform generation plugin out there with this many settings! Plus, with real-time preview and rapid response, even with the myriad of settings, your journey to find the perfect waveform will be stress-free.

Refresh & Insert Buttons

If you wish to regenerate the waveform with the current settings, simply click the Refresh button.

Once you're satisfied with the waveform, hit the Insert button, and the waveform will be generated instantly on your Figma canvas.


How to Use

  1. Launch the plugin.
  2. Adjust the parameters on the right side of the screen to achieve your desired waveform. Alternatively, you can also use the Presets available at the bottom left of the screen (presets can be applied with a single click).
  3. Once you've crafted your preferred waveform, press the "Insert to Figma" button. The waveform will be added to the selected location (or the center of the canvas if nothing is selected).

plugins.tagline: The most high-performance waveform generation plugin for Figma

100174.name: Wave Generator
100174.description:
Overview

Wave Generator is a Figma plugin designed to flexibly and efficiently create waveforms that are invaluable for various design productions. It was born to assist and enhance your designs.

It's sure to be a valuable asset in elevating your design work.


Features

RealTime Preview

Each time you adjust the settings within the plugin, you can see how the waveform transforms in real-time. Play around with various settings to create your ideal waveform.

Presets

I've prepared a variety of waveforms (presets) for you to choose from. Feel free to use any that you prefer. (If this plugin proves useful to many of you, I'm considering adding, saving, and sharing preset features in the future.)

Parameters

This plugin boasts a vast array of settings:

  1. Curve type
  2. Overall waveform type
  3. Number of waves
  4. Height difference between waves
  5. Wave intensity
  6. Number of wave reflections
  7. Presence and color of fill
  8. Presence, color, and width of the stroke

There probably isn't another waveform generation plugin out there with this many settings! Plus, with real-time preview and rapid response, even with the myriad of settings, your journey to find the perfect waveform will be stress-free.

Refresh & Insert Buttons

If you wish to regenerate the waveform with the current settings, simply click the Refresh button.

Once you're satisfied with the waveform, hit the Insert button, and the waveform will be generated instantly on your Figma canvas.


How to Use

  1. Launch the plugin.
  2. Adjust the parameters on the right side of the screen to achieve your desired waveform. Alternatively, you can also use the Presets available at the bottom left of the screen (presets can be applied with a single click).
  3. Once you've crafted your preferred waveform, press the "Insert to Figma" button. The waveform will be added to the selected location (or the center of the canvas if nothing is selected).

Bug Fix: Resolved Waveform Rendering Issue

Fix: We updated the waveform rendering library to the latest version, resolving this issue.
Impact: This bug fix has stabilized waveform rendering, allowing for accurate display.

plugins.name: Flow Exporter
plugins.description:
Flow is the most powerful, easy to use tool for animating your Figma designs.


Want to add flair to an element of your design? Flow's exporter has your back.

 

  1. Select one or more layers.
  2. Make them exportable.
  3. In Flow, import your Figma file and you‚Äôre good to go.


It saves you the hassle of pulling apart your design into separate frames and projects, letting you get to what's important: animating and creating great products.


When you're ready, you can ship code or media files. Here's what you can export:

  • Lottie files (for iOS, Android and Web)
  • iOS Swift code (as an Xcode project)
  • HTML / CSS / JS (Web Animations)
  • React
  • MOV / MP4
  • Single frame or Animated GIF / PNG

plugins.name: Styles to Variables Converter
plugins.description:
This plugin takes your color styles and converts them into new Figma variables, reflecting their structure, names and descriptions.


Local library

If you use your library locally only (in the same file), after running the plugin, you can safely delete all converted styles ‚Äì layers that were using these styles will now have a variable bound to them.


Published library

In order to safely remove styles using published library, you should do it in 5 steps:

  1. Use plugin (it will preserve styles but with references to the newly created variables).
  2. Publish the library (with styles that now refer to variables instead of hex values).
  3. Update files with new styles (the styles will still be applied to layers, but now with bound variables; depending on the design operations, you may need to wait a few weeks until every current file is updated).
  4. Remove styles from the library.
  5. Publish library (for unknown reasons, I found this step unnecessary, but I would still recommend doing it).


How it works:

  1. Getting all local styles that are convertible (single, solid fills)
  2. Creating new variables based on gotten styles
  3. Binding variables back to styles definition


Keep in mind, that not every "color" style could be converted to variable. Styles with multiple fills, gradients, images, and videos won't be converted, so don't delete them after conversion.


Watch out for duplicate style names because while styles can have duplicate names, variables are still required to have unique names ‚Äì the plugin skips such duplicates.


Since variables cannot use some characters (., $, {, }) in their name, they are replaced with underscores (_). In some cases it might result in additional duplicates that will be skipped.


Hopefully, this plugin will save you some time. I would greatly appreciate your feedback.
plugins.tagline: Convert existing styles into new variables

61320.release_notes:
‚Ä¢ Replacing invalid characters: The plugin now replaces invalid characters (`.`, `$`, `{` and `}`) with underscores (`_`). This change can be useful to prevent issues during conversion.
‚Ä¢ Trimming spaces around slashes: The plugin now ensures that spaces around slashes are trimmed. This change ensures consistent behavior in case Figma doesn't handle this automatically.

plugins.name: Swap colors (Switch Selection Colors)
plugins.description:
Swap colors in a click


Note

In some cases, where the swap is not technically possible you might see the colors swap partially. You can simply undo in those situation if you do not like the result.


For example:

A "Recatangle 1" has two fills "Fill A" and "Fill B".

A "Recatangle 2" has a color style named "Color Style C"

Here you can't swap "Fill A" with the "Color Style C" because you might loose "Fill B" in the process


Currently figma support applying multiple fills to an element. But it does not applying multiple color styles as fill. You can have a workaround for this limitation by adding multiple properties to a single color style.

accepted.name: Varun
accepted.description: Designer & Developer

plugins.tagline: Swap any two colors easiy and precisely

plugins.name: FigAct  - Figma to React, React Hooks, React Router and dynamic data display from API call
plugins.description:
Convert Figma designs to ReactJS source code with high quality, responsive React, ReactJS, JSX with React Router, React Hooks and Airtable integration with dynamic visualization of data.


You can take this sample template as a reference in order to enhance the accuracy of the ReactJS code which was generated from your Figma Files

https://www.figma.com/community/file/1104105411031025831

Here is the source code generated by FigAct using the above sample template:

https://github.com/nguyentathung943/figact-generated-sample-template-react-code


How does FigAct work?

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Fill in the credentials as required
  3. FigAct will generate the full project of all the frames under the ReactJS folder structure and put them in a zip file
  4. Download the generated zip file and extract it into a folder
  5. Open your system command line and hit npm install and npm run start to view your project with all frames generated with ReactJS (please make sure that you already have Node.js installed in your local machine)


Why FigAct?

  • Turn your design into high quality and responsive ReactJS with navigation and button event within one click with the accuracy rate from 80% to 90%
  • Quickly turn design components into real site components with every pixel is accurately positioned according to the original designs
  • React Router for frame navigations, you can use interactions (navigate to) from Figma to switch amongst pages in your source code as you perform on Figma
  • React Hooks for state management is supported. We use state for special components
  • Automated asset management with images are downloaded and imported automatically in the project zip file
  • Support SOLID and LINEAR_GRADIENT fill on Figma for every component
  • Fonts are imported automatically from Google Fonts
  • FigAct can generate recycle component as one of the most interesting feature of React.


Airtable integration with dynamic visualization of data

  • You can visualize your data under list and carousel format easily and dynamically with data fetched from your API Service
  • FigAct generates the function in your source code to get the data from your API Service or bases on credentials you provided and displays it dynamically if the data is changed from your API service or from your table in
  • If you have no API service, we have Airtable integrated with FigAct for you
  • Click here to read more and follow some rules to make it work


Limitations

FigAct can turn your Figma designs into ReactJS source code within few seconds per frame which helps you to save tons of effort to do so. However, to make the source code to be generated accurately, there are only few things that you have to comply with. Click here to read some rules.


A few known limitations:

  • Not all element types are supported (e.g. pseudoelements, ..)
  • Not all CSS properties are supported or fully supported
  • Only support onClick action for page navigation
  • Types of media (audio, video,...) are not supported
  • Only support SOLID and LINEAR_GRADIENT color type
  • Images sometimes cannot be downloaded from your figma files
  • The size of your frame will be automatically set to 1440px according to the designs standard


Our website

Visit our website for demos and documentation: https://figact.vercel.app


Contact and more

Thanks for downloading and using FigAct

This is our university thesis. If there is any issues or suggestions, please write down so we can listen.


Find us on LinkedIn

www.linkedin.com/in/nguyentathung943

www.linkedin.com/in/nguyen-t-b55476124/


Email: figact.hcmus@gmail.com

Department of Software Engineering

plugins.name: Neonize
plugins.description:
Enhance your designs with luminous glows


What Neonize Offers:

  • Glow Color: Using our in-built color picker on the plugin, select any color of your choice to alter the glow color.
  • Glow Intensity: A range slider that adjusts the intensity of the glow on your selections..
  • Selection Types: The plugin can only be used on rectangles, ellipses, polygons, lines, stars, arrows, vectors, and text.


How to Use Neonize:

  1. Select a Node: Choose the design element you want to enhance. Valid nodes: rectangle, ellipse, polygon, line, star, arrows, vector, text.
  2. Adjust glow intensity: Drag the knob on the slider to intensify the glow brightness on the selected shape or text.
  3. Pick a Color: Use the color picker on the plugin to select the desired glow color.

Limitations:

  • Neonize is optimized to work on specific target types. This includes rectangle, ellipse, polygon, line, star, arrows, vector, text.
  • The plugin has not yet been tested properly to enhance multiple nodes simultaneously, and could mean that unexpected results could be rendered when attempting to run Neonize on several nodes at the same time.


Upcoming updates:

  • User interface will be updated to a more appealing design
  • Button to apply effects
  • Button to reset affects.
  • Feature to multiple the intensity glow.

Feedback: User experience is of utmost priority to me. For any feedback, you are more then welcome to use the comment section. By leaving your comments, this helps me to improve Neonize for more users that use the plugin.

Contact:

plugins.name: Split to frames
plugins.description:
Split your design into a carousel or grid easily for social media or onboarding screens.


Demo here.

Support my work here <3


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


How to use this plugin:

  1. Select a frame/component
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Choose width & height / Rows & columns that you want to split by (For example: 1080x1080 for Instagram carousel)
  4. Click on 'Add grid' to add a grid that is based on your selection
  5. Click on 'Split to frames' to split


Nice tip:

  1. Set the original frame as component
  2. Split the frame
  3. The new frames will be created as 'instances'
  4. Keep editing the component and all the smaller frames will be updated automatically


An important note:

Make sure the original frame's size is a duplication of the values you enter.
plugins.tagline: Split your design into a carousel or grid easily for social media or onboarding screens.

plugins.name: Flowy
plugins.description:
This plugin empowers users to effortlessly create and customize seamless links (user flows) between components in Figma, enhancing their design process and workflow.


To use this plugin, follow these simple steps:


1. Select the first component as the starting point of the connection.

2. Hold down the Shift key.

3. Click on the second component to complete the connection.

4. Release the Shift key.


Once connected, the plugin establishes a flow connection between the two components. Customize the connector settings, such as size, color, corner radius, and stroke cap, to align with your design requirements.


The connectors stick to the components even when moved or resized, ensuring your connections remain intact and visually appealing.


Features:

  1. Two types of connectors: Ortho and Curve.
  2. Customizable connector settings, including size, color, corner radius, stroke cap, and position.
  3. Sticky Connectors.
  4. Locally saved settings for a personalized experience.
  5. Light/Dark theme.
  6. Add "Tag" to the connector
  7. Enable/Disable the Plugins for ease of use when designing
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create and customize connections (user flows) between components in Figma.

plugins.name: Color Shades & Tints Generator
plugins.description:
About

The Tints and Shade Generator Plugin is a tool that simplifies the process of generating tints and shades of desired colors. Its features include easy selection of color-filled shapes, ability to generate multiple tints or shades at once, and notifications upon completion. This plugin is an essential tool for designers and artists looking to streamline their workflow.


How to use

  1. Select at least one shape that is filled with color. (You have the option to select between 1 to a maximum of 10 shapes)
  2. Run The Plugin
  3. Select the "Generate Tints" or "Generate Shades" button depending on your requirements.
  4. If you select "Generate Tints" Button tints of the selected color will be generated.
  5. If you select "Generate Shade" Button tints of the selected color will be generated.
  6. The user will be notified when the tints or shades have been generated.

accepted.name: Snehal
accepted.description: https://www.linkedin.com/in/snehalshivankar/

plugins.tagline: "Effortlessly create stunning color palettes with our Color Shades & Tints Generator!"

  5. If you select "Generate Shade" Button tints of the selected color will be generated.
  6. The user will be notified when the tints or shades have been generated.

plugins.name: Image Colorizer - Instantly Change Image Colors
plugins.description:
With one click, Image Colorizer allows you to change the color of selected images (from icons to photos) in your Figma designs while preserving intricate details.


Key features include:


  1. Apply custom colors to multiple images simultaneously
  2. Preserve image details using advanced blending techniques
  3. Generate high-resolution versions of colorized images
  4. Simple, intuitive interface for quick color changes


Perfect for creating color variations of icons, illustrations, or photos without leaving Figma.


How to use:


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select the images you want to apply color to (up to 28 images)
  3. Use an image background remover plugin to remove backgrounds (if needed)


Streamline your workflow and explore new color palettes with ease!
